div.head: To his honored, and dearely affected Master, Mr WILLIAM BALLE, Son and Heire to the Worshipfull PETER BALLE Esquire.
div.p:
I Am the more emboldned to Present you with these fragments of Poetrie, in regard you begin to be one of the little darlings of the Muses. It is not the least of my comforts to see from a sprig of my owne pruning, such timely blossomes
of Poetical ingenuity: somwhat rare it is to see Plants of wit agree with the hard coldnesse of our Climate; for this aurum cuncta movens hath so stupified the times, that Ignorance hath almost outfac'd Invention. Apuleius may wander up and down the Arcadian plains to find Parnassus or the Heliconian Well, and meet none but the dull brood of Midas to direct him.
